required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Flat OGTT (Oral Glucose Tolerance Test) During Pregnancy
clinical_study.official_title: The Flat OGTT During Pregnancy -Prevalence and Risk for Adverse Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to examine the relationship between "flat" sugar curve on OGTT-glucose tolerance test during pregnancy, neonatal birthweight and other perinatal outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: A retrospective cohort analysis of all women delivered in one university affiliated medical center between January 1st 2018 and December 31th 2019 with documented 100 grams OGTT results.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the characteristics and perinatal outcomes of parturients with a flat glucose curve on 100 grams oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT).
primary_outcome.description: A flat OGTT curve occurs in a younger, leaner population. Although flat OGTT can possibly reflect some degree of hyperinsulinemia, it is generally not associated with adverse maternal or neonatal outcomes.

study_pop.textblock: All women delivered in one university affiliated medical center between January 1st 2018 and December 31th 2019 with documented 100 grams OGTT results.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Performing the OGTT test during the pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- lack of documentation or Non-performance of OGTT test during the pregnancy.

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Hillel-Yaffe Medical Center
